alert.note: Alert for Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Lower Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest; Northwest Blue Mountains; Simcoe Highlands; Upper Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued April 08 at 11:15AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...RISES ON STREAMS AND RIVERS EXPECTED DUE TO SNOWMELT AND RAIN... Small streams and large rivers coming out of the mountains will see rises over the weekend and through the first half of next week. A weather system will approach the Pacific Northwest coast on Sunday. Rain showers are expected to increase in area coverage Sunday night and Monday especially in the area mountains such as the Washington and Oregon cascades. The showers and periods of rain is forecast to persist into the beginning of next week. Uncertainty lies in where exactly the band of heaviest precipitation will occur Monday and Tuesday, but expectation is that the largest rises in rivers, streams, and creeks will occur during this period. While only a few gauges are expected to even approach bankfull, much could change with the rain forecast between now and early next week. As of now, however, flooding is not expected to occur with this round of rainfall over the next several days. This Hydrologic Outlook will be updated again Sunday with the latest updates to the forecast.
